metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: To create a table in MySQL, use the "CREATE TABLE" statement.
content.html: To create a table in MySQL, use the "CREATE TABLE" statement.

content.text: Make sure you define the name of the database when you create the connection:
content.html: Make sure you define the name of the database when you create the connection:

content.code_html:
var mysql = require('mysql');

var con = mysql.createConnection({
  host: "localhost",
  user: "yourusername",
  password: "yourpassword",
  database: "mydb"
});

con.connect(function(err) {
  if (err) throw err;
  console.log("Connected!");
  var sql = "CREATE TABLE customers (name VARCHAR(255), address VARCHAR(255))";
  con.query(sql, function (err, result) {
    if (err) throw err;
    console.log("Table created");
  });
});

content.text: Save the code above in a file called "demo_create_table.js" and run the file:
content.html: Save the code above in a file called "demo_create_table.js" and run the file:

content.code_html: C:\Users\Your Name>node demo_create_table.js

content.text: Which will give you this result:
When creating a table, you should also create a column with a unique key for each record.
content.html: When creating a table, you should also create a column with a unique key for each record.

content.text: This can be done by defining a column as "INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY" which will insert a unique number for each record. Starting at 1, and increased by one for each record.
content.html: This can be done by defining a column as "INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY" which will insert a unique number for each record. Starting at 1, and increased by one for each record.

syntaxHighlighting.text:
"CREATE TABLE customers (id INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY 
  KEY, name VARCHAR(255), 
  address VARCHAR(255))"

syntax_highlighting.text:
"CREATE TABLE customers (id INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY 
  KEY, name VARCHAR(255), 
  address VARCHAR(255))"

content.code_html:
var mysql = require('mysql');

var con = mysql.createConnection({
  host: "localhost",
  user: "yourusername",
  password: "yourpassword",
  database: "mydb"
});

con.connect(function(err) {
  if (err) throw err;
  console.log("Connected!");
  var sql = "CREATE TABLE customers (id INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(255), address VARCHAR(255))";
  con.query(sql, function (err, result) {
    if (err) throw err;
    console.log("Table created");
  });
});

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
"CREATE TABLE customers (id INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY 
  KEY, name VARCHAR(255), 
  address VARCHAR(255))"

content.text: If the table already exists, use the ALTER TABLE keyword:
content.html: If the table already exists, use the ALTER TABLE keyword:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
"ALTER TABLE customers ADD COLUMN id INT AUTO_INCREMENT 
  PRIMARY KEY"

syntax_highlighting.text:
"ALTER TABLE customers ADD COLUMN id INT AUTO_INCREMENT 
  PRIMARY KEY"

content.code_html:
var mysql = require('mysql');

var con = mysql.createConnection({
  host: "localhost",
  user: "yourusername",
  password: "yourpassword",
  database: "mydb"
});

con.connect(function(err) {
  if (err) throw err;
  console.log("Connected!");
  var sql = "ALTER TABLE customers ADD COLUMN id INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY";
  con.query(sql, function (err, result) {
    if (err) throw err;
    console.log("Table altered");
  });
});

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
"ALTER TABLE customers ADD COLUMN id INT AUTO_INCREMENT 
  PRIMARY KEY"
